snippet: The O’Bannon case says that the N.C.A.A. violated the law by price-fixing. In another case, two universities argued that the N.C.A.A. restrained trade by controlling television contracts.
lead_paragraph: The O’Bannon case says that the N.C.A.A. violated the law by price-fixing. In another case, two universities argued that the N.C.A.A. restrained trade by controlling television contracts.

headline.main: 30-Year-Old Decision Could Serve as Template for N.C.A.A. Antitrust Case
